oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cumberland Gap: property survey and history
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Staff of the Center for Historic Preservation, MTSU
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Roughly bounded by Colwyn, Cumberland, Pennlyn, and the L & N Railroad tracks, Cumberland Gap, Claiborne County, TN
Property survey and history of the Cumberland Gap Historic District

For over two hundred years, Cumberland Gap has served as a significant passageway to the lands west of the Appalachian mountains. The Cumberland Gap Historic District is significant as evidence to the patterns of Claiborne County's history as a late nineteenth and early twentieth century mining town funded by foreign capitalists as well as its associations with Wilderness Road. American Association, Limited had its headquarters in Cumberland Gap.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Historic districts; Historic buildings; National Register of Historic Places
